channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Ari Shapiro, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: What the jury in the Sean Combs trial will be deliberating
item.description: The jury considering the charges of racketeering conspiracy, sex trafficking and transportation for prostitution against the music mogul Sean Combs began its deliberations.

item.title: The latest in the deadly firefighter ambush in Idaho
item.description: Authorities in Idaho are trying to learn more about the man they say started a fire, then ambushed and shot three responding firefighters, killing two. The suspect is dead and his motive is unknown.

item.title: Republicans look to Medicaid work requirements to save taxpayer money in budget bill
item.description: Work requirements for Medicaid are proposed as a way to cut costs in the big budget bill. Studies find they achieve cost savings by kicking off legitimate beneficiaries because of a paperwork burden.

item.title: What to know about the Bob Vylan controversy at Glastonbury
item.description: A punk duo is under investigation in the U.K. and banned from performing in the U.S., after its singer led anti-Israeli military chants during a BBC live broadcast of the Glastonbury arts festival.

item.title: Review: Karol G went for a pan-Latin sound in new album 'Tropicoqueta'
item.description: NPR'S Andrew Limbong and Anamaria Sayer review the latest album from Karol G, Tropicoqueta.

item.title: How a glucose monitor can help tame blood sugar spikes and crashes
item.description: After a meal some people experience high spikes in blood sugar followed by a crashing low. The dips can cause fatigue, moodiness and lead to overeating. Learning how to manage your blood sugar can help.

item.title: The Supreme Court has created an endless summer of work for itself
item.description: The court closed its latest term on Friday, but it will still be working on a steady stream of emergency appeals in the coming weeks and months.

item.title: Zohran Mamdani talks about how he won the NYC Democratic mayoral primary
item.description: It may have come as a shock to the political world, but something about Zohran Mamdani's message resonated with Democratic voters for New York City Mayor.

item.title: A rare German Bible found in Texas is now digitized
item.description: A 1983 routine cleaning at Boerne High School in Texas yielded a rare and precious find: a thick, ornate Bible wrapped in cloth and written in low German. Now it will soon be seen online.

item.title: Senate heads to final vote on megabill
item.description: The Senate is holding amendment votes on the GOP tax and spending bill ahead of as self-imposed July 4 deadline for getting the bill to President Trump's desk.
